content: The first section of the report outlines the FY2017 judiciary appropriations process, including key actions such as request submission, hearings, markups, floor considerations, and the enactment of the Consolidated Appropriations Act, 2017 on May 5, 2017. The FY2017 judiciary appropriations process included key actions such as request submission, hearings, markups, House floor consideration of H.R. 5485, continuing resolutions, and the enactment of the Consolidated Appropriations Act, 2017 on May 5, 2017. The Budget for Fiscal Year 2017 requested $7.58 billion in new budget authority for judicial branch activities. In 2017, a budget request of $7.58 billion was submitted for judicial branch activities, including discretionary and mandatory funding for judges' salaries. The House and Senate Appropriations Subcommittees did not hold hearings on the request, but the House subcommittee accepted submissions until March 17, 2016. On May 25, the House Appropriations Committee Subcommittee on Financial Services and General considered the budget. The House subcommittee accepted programmatic and language submissions for the FY2017 judicial branch budget request until March 17, 2016. On May 25, the House Appropriations Committee Subcommittee on Financial Services and General Government recommended $7.55 billion in funds for the judiciary, including mandatory funds for judges' salaries and benefits. On June 9, 2016, the House Appropriations Committee approved the same amount for the judiciary in the FY2017 budget.
